snippet: Armando Calderon is one of many who share a single mailing address: 390 Ninth Avenue, New York City’s main post office, is where the homeless get mail — or don’t.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column on the dozens of homeless people who line up outside the James A Farley Post Office in Manhattan each week to retrieve their mail; examines tale of Armando Calderon, Chicago man who vanished 30 years ago and may be living, homeless, in New York; his family regularly sends mail to him at Farley Post Office in hopes of one day connecting again.
lead_paragraph: Armando Calderon is one of many who share a single mailing address: 390 Ninth Avenue, New York City’s main post office, is where the homeless get mail — or don’t.

headline.main: A Manhattan Post Office Is the Only Address Some People Have
headline.print_headline: A Manhattan Post Office Is the Only Address Some People Have
